thread.title: One Conservative, Two Moderates in Florida Senate Race | Election 2012
thread.title_full: One Conservative, Two Moderates in Florida Senate Race | Election 2012

author: beforeitsnews.com
title: One Conservative, Two Moderates in Florida Senate Race | Election 2012
text:
(Before It's News)
In the race for U.S. Senate in Florida, there is one conservative and two moderate Republicans. The conservative is Congressman Ron DeSantis (R-FL) whom we have endorsed. The moderates are Congressman David Jolly (R-FL) and Lt. Gov. Carlos Lopez-Cantera. Here’s a quick list of things in their records to be aware of.
David Jolly (R-FL) One of the most liberal Republicans with a 42% Liberty Score Opposed overturning the DC abortion mandate Voted for the “cromnibus” spending bill Voted against repealing the death tax Voted for a bill that funded Planned Parenthood, the Iran nuclear deal, and Obamacare Voted to fund Executive Amnesty Voted to extend the Export-Import Bank Voted for a budget-busting highway bill
Carlos Lopez-Cantera (R-FL) Supported Charlie Crist’s budget, with included a massive tax increase Supported in-state tuition for illegal immigrants Opposed an anti-illegal immigration law similar to the one passed in Arizona Lead the fight for public funding for the Marlins baseball stadium
Please support the conservative candidate in this race, Congressman Ron DeSantis.
Click here to donate to his campaign.
